intro: Razumovia cochinchinensis var. lutea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered razumovia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. The flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the spring and summer months.
